PBS News reporter Judy Woodruff issued a retraction on Wednesday after she falsely reported at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) that Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump was trying to sabotage a hostage deal between Hamas and Israel because it would help Democrat presidential nominee Vice President Kamala Harris.

“I want to clarify my remarks on the PBS News special on Monday night about the ongoing cease fire talks in the Middle East,” she said in a post on X. “As I said, this was not based on my original reporting; I was referring to reports I had read, in Axios and Reuters, about former President Trump having spoken to the Israeli Prime Minister.”

“In the live TV moment, I repeated the story because I hadn’t seen later reporting that both sides denied it,” she continued. “This was a mistake and I apologize for it.”

Woodruff said on Monday night: “The reporting is that former President Trump is on the phone with the Prime Minister of Israel, urging him not to cut a deal right now, because that it’s believed that would help the Harris campaign.”

“So I don’t know where, where that–, I don’t know, who knows whether that will come about or not, but I have to think that the Harris campaign would like for President Biden to do what presidents do, which is work on that one,” she added.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

NEWS

PBS‚Äô Judy Woodruff has issued a clarification and an apology for her remarks in this clip which went viral.

‚ÄúI want to clarify my remarks on the PBS News special on Monday night about the ongoing cease fire talks in the Middle East.

As I said, this was not based on my‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/4nIhczmpj5

‚Äî Yashar Ali üêò (@yashar) August 21, 2024

Woodruff’s statement came after Trump campaign surrogate Rep. Mike Waltz (R-FL) demanded that she retract what she said on air, calling it “false” and “ridiculous.”

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office responded to Woodruff’s claim by saying that it was a “complete lie.”

Trump campaign surrogate @michaelgwaltz calls on @JudyWoodruff of PBS to RETRACT her report that Trump is urging Netanyahu to reject a hostage deal

‚ÄúThat is false. It‚Äôs ridiculous.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/16ZCRiXICK

‚Äî Brent Scher (@BrentScher) August 21, 2024

item.title: Whistleblowers Risk Everything To Expose Shocking Practices At Texas Children‚Äôs Hospital
item.dc:creator: Matt Walsh
item.description: Texas Children’s Hospital in Houston is the largest children’s hospital in the world. They treat more than four million patients under the age of 21 every year, most of them minors. And because of the hospital’s size and prestige, what happens at TCH doesn’t just affect those patients. What happens at TCH also influences how ...
item.content:encoded:
Texas Children’s Hospital in Houston is the largest children’s hospital in the world. They treat more than four million patients under the age of 21 every year, most of them minors. And because of the hospital’s size and prestige, what happens at TCH doesn’t just affect those patients. What happens at TCH also influences how other major children’s hospitals all around the country conduct their operations.

That’s what makes the reporting out of Texas Children’s Hospital this year ‚Äî most of it done by Chris Rufo ‚Äî impossible to ignore. In the span of a little over a year, two whistleblowers have come forward to allege that TCH is systemically deceiving the public and potentially violating the law.

The first whistleblower, a general surgeon named Eithan Haim, provided records to Rufo which demonstrated that TCH had not, in fact, shut down its child sex-change program as promised. This was significant because the attorney general of Texas, Ken Paxton, had just released a legal opinion stating that child sex-change surgeries ‚Äî as well as cross-sex hormone treatments ‚Äî constitutes child abuse under Texas law. So TCH claimed that they shut the program down in order to avoid prosecution. As the hospital put it, they wanted to:

safeguard our health care professionals and impacted families from potential criminal legal ramification.

So they stood by the child sterilization, but they said they had no choice but to comply with the attorney general.

According to Rufo’s reporting, Haim provided redacted records proving that TCH then quietly restarted the program without informing the public. In effect, they didn’t really shut it down at all. Haim didn’t give Rufo any personally identifying information about any patients, and no personally identifiable information was ever released publicly. He provided only the information that was necessary to verify that TCH was continuing to perform procedures related to child sex-changes, in apparent defiance of the attorney general.

For example, the records reportedly demonstrated that TCH allowed a doctor to, ‚Äúinsert a non-biodegradable drug delivery implant‚Äù into an 11-year-old girl who identified as transgender. The records also indicated that several children between the ages of 11 and 15 received these implants, among many other procedures.

The Texas legislature clearly thought Haim’s revelations were worth acting on. The very next day after Rufo published his report on Haim’s claims, the Texas legislature voted ‚Äî in bipartisan fashion ‚Äî to ban so-called “gender-affirming care” for minors. So the attorney general’s legal opinion wasn’t just an opinion anymore. It was binding on hospitals like TCH.

WATCH: The Matt Walsh Show

On these facts, there’s no question that Eithan Haim is a whistleblower by any definition.

He chose to risk career ‚Äî which was just beginning ‚Äî to provide information that his employer might be systematically violating the law. And not just any law ‚Äî but a law designed to protect children from being abused and permanently sterilized. On top of that, Haim’s evidence indicated that TCH might be lying to the public, which is a pretty big deal when you’re talking about a children’s hospital. If they’re willing to lie about castrating children, it might lead you to wonder what else they’re willing to lie about, and how deep the corruption goes. Haim’s disclosures directly led to a substantial change in Texas law, in record time, which means that by definition, they were highly relevant to the public interest. You cannot define “whistleblower” anymore clearly than this.

But Joe Biden and Kamala Harris’ DOJ didn’t see it that way.

A month later, they sent federal agents to his door to inform him that he was under investigation for HIPAA violations.

Shortly afterwards, he was indicted. Watch:

So according to the DOJ, Eithan Haim wanted to cause “malicious harm” to the hospital. They’re not concerned about the permanent harm that this massive and well-funded hospital may be causing to children. Instead, the prosecutors are worried about the “harm” that the hospital might suffer when the public learns what it’s doing, in defiance of the attorney general and Texas law.

This is a hospital that, by the way, receives a lot of money and tax breaks from the government. We have every right to know what it’s doing. But apparently the hospital’s employees are not allowed to “harm” the hospital by informing the public about the procedures they’re performing.

You might remember that Democrats didn’t always treat whistleblowers this way. During the Trump administration, a CIA operative who was assigned to the White House leaked classified recordings of Trump to Adam Schiff. That led to the first impeachment trial. We weren’t even allowed to know the CIA operative’s name at any point during the proceedings. Corporate media outlets refused to tell us. Even in Congress, lawmakers were told it was off-limits to reveal his identity. John Roberts, who was presiding over the impeachment, enforced that rule. This was a “whistleblower” who wasn’t even alleging that Trump had violated any law. And yet, this CIA employee was treated with such reverence that, to this day, we’re not allowed to say his name in public.

But Eithan Haim ‚Äî who actually displayed real bravery, and who disclosed relevant information about a children’s hospital ‚Äî now faces up to a decade in prison if convicted. His life gets destroyed and his career is ended, all for telling the truth. And he’s not the only one.

This week, a nurse named Vanessa Sivadge revealed that she was recently fired by Texas Children’s Hospital. Her crime was alleging that TCH bills Medicaid to provide puberty blockers and cross-sex hormones to children, in violation of federal law. TCH immediately denied this allegation.

Then the Biden administration sent more federal agents to harass her at her home, because that’s what happens when you start saying inconvenient things about so-called “gender affirming care.” Watch:

This is where we are now: The Biden Administration sent two FBI agents to intimidate a nurse who told the truth about the child sex-change program at Texas Children's Hospital. The regime is mobilizing to threaten and imprison anyone who opposes "transgender medicine." pic.twitter.com/XbtZVnp5Kw

— Christopher F. Rufo ‚öîÔ∏è (@realchrisrufo) June 18, 2024

 

The only reason these agents showed up to Sivadge’s home was to intimidate her. They weren’t there to arrest her. They weren’t there to inform her that she was the target of any investigation. The point was to imply that she’d better keep her mouth shut because the federal government was watching her.

In a letter to Rufo, Sivadge said she had attempted to transfer away from the endocrine unit as a last-ditch effort to avoid working in this area of so-called medicine, but the hospital refused her request:

This past Friday on August 16, TCH fired me effective immediately. This is unlawful for two reasons: it is retaliation for my coming forward with information on TCH‚Äôs egregious pattern of deception and Medicaid fraud, and this action also illegally disregarded my request to transfer due to my belief that these procedures provide irreversible harm and lifelong regret to children confused by their sex.

If it’s true that TCH is defrauding Medicaid, it wouldn’t be particularly surprising. Last year, I posted a Twitter thread looking to two of the largest so-called “trans healthcare” providers, known as Plume and Folx. And both of these providers indicated that they diagnose patients with “dysphoria,” even if they don’t really have it, in order to ensure that insurance pays out. In fact, Folx openly admitted doing this on their website. This is the kind of apparent fraud that can take place openly when your industry has the full backing of the Biden DOJ. When you know the government’s on your side, you can admit to fraud in public and no one does anything. It’s the people who point out the fraud who get harassed and even jailed.

What’s particularly troubling about the situation at TCH is that Vanessa Sivadge was clearly in a position to know if the hospital was defrauding Medicaid. She interacted with doctors who were ordering various procedures and medications, and she coordinated prescription refills all the time. She once taught a child how to inject sex-change hormones. It was her job, which she performed up until the moment she realized how immoral it was.

As Sivadge put it:

In the cardiac clinic, we were taking sick kids and making them better. In the transgender clinic, it was the opposite. We were harming these kids.

So there’s only two possibilities here. Either this nurse is, for some reason, lying about her own first-hand observations, knowing it would completely destroy her career and her life. Or, like Eithan Haim, she’s telling the truth. And right now the latter explanation seems a lot more believable.

In response to her termination, Sivadge posted just two words on social media: “Worth it.”

That’s the kind of response you’d expect from someone who knows that the Texas attorney general’s investigation is going to validate everything she said. It’s a rare example of bravery in an industry that’s sorely lacking it. And it’s exactly what it will take to end this insanity and stop the mutilation and sterilization of children.¬†

These two whistleblowers alone have had a major impact. What happens next at Texas Children’s Hospital could determine what happens not just to the millions of children in their care, but to all the other children’s hospitals that look to TCH for guidance.

What’s needed now is for more whistleblowers to come forward, to follow their conscience and to expose this fraudulent industry for what it is.

item.title: Republican AGs Warn Apple About Entrepreneur Program That Excludes White, Asian Men
item.dc:creator: Leif Le Mahieu
item.description: A coalition of 14 Republican attorneys general warned Apple on Wednesday that its ‚Äúdiscriminatory‚Äù entrepreneur programs excluding white and Asian men may be illegal. Led by West Virginia Attorney General Patrick Morrisey, the Republican officials sent a letter to Apple after it opened up applications last week for its ‚ÄúEntrepreneurship Camp‚Äù exclusively for minorities and ...
item.content:encoded:
A coalition of 14 Republican attorneys general warned Apple on Wednesday that its ‚Äúdiscriminatory‚Äù entrepreneur programs excluding white and Asian men may be illegal.

Led by West Virginia Attorney General Patrick Morrisey, the Republican officials sent a letter to Apple after it opened up applications last week for its ‚ÄúEntrepreneurship Camp‚Äù exclusively for minorities and women. The letter, addressed to Apple Senior Vice President Katherine Adams, says that the application stipulations may violate federal discrimination law.

‚ÄúApple should abandon this wrong-headed and exclusionary approach. As it stands, the program reflects a troubling fixation on race and sex ‚Äî and looks to run afoul of anti-discrimination laws. While supporting up-and-coming developers may be a laudable goal, this harmful strategy is not the way to do it,‚Äù the attorneys general wrote.

‚ÄúAnd given how you sell your products in our States‚Äîand recruit developers, engineers, and others from our States, too‚Äîwe cannot give tacit approval to your methods. Indeed, by hosting some of these camps remotely, we think Apple is effectively exporting discrimination to our States,‚Äù they added.

Joining Morrisey were the attorneys general of Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Idaho, Iowa, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, South Carolina, South Dakota, and Texas.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

Apple faced backlash from conservatives last week after it posted its requirements for its ‚ÄúApple Entrepreneur Camp‚Äù on August 13. According to the tech company, the camp ‚Äúsupports underrepresented founders and developers, and encourages the pipeline and longevity of these entrepreneurs in technology.‚Äù

The posting from the company said that all ‚Äúfemale,* Black, Hispanic/Latinx, and Indigenous‚Äù developers were welcome to apply. The asterisks around ‚Äúfemale‚Äù pointed to a note that said that Apple ‚Äúbelieves that gender expression is a fundamental right. We welcome all women to apply to this program.‚Äù

The Republicans said that Apple was sowing social division through the program and pushing ‚Äúintentional discrimination.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf Apple wants to open the doors to underrepresented persons, we can conceive of plenty of ways to do so without engaging in ugly race- and sex-based classifications. It could target those who don‚Äôt hail from elite educational institutions,‚Äù they wrote. ‚ÄúIt could target those from lower socio-economic classes. It could target persons from parts of our country that haven‚Äôt yet experienced a boom in app development.‚Äù

In recent months, corporations around the country have faced backlash from customers for pushing woke policies and implementing DEI requirements.

item.title: ‚ÄòSo Far Amazing‚Äô: Tim Allen Reacts To Reading The Bible
item.dc:creator: Amanda Harding
item.description: Actor and comedian Tim Allen updated X followers to let them know he was taking time to read the Bible. ‚ÄúNever took the time in all my years to ever read and really read the Bible. Currently almost through the Jerusalem Bible Old Testament and almost done with the Prophets. Next up to New Testament. ...
item.content:encoded:
Actor and comedian Tim Allen updated X followers to let them know he was taking time to read the Bible.

‚ÄúNever took the time in all my years to ever read and really read the Bible. Currently almost through the Jerusalem Bible Old Testament and almost done with the Prophets. Next up to New Testament. So far amazing and not at all what I was expecting,‚Äù he posted on Tuesday night.

Never took the time in all my years to ever read and really read the Bible. Currently almost through the Jerusalem Bible Old Testament and almost done with the Prophets. Next up to New Testament. So far amazing and not at all what I was expecting.

‚Äî Tim Allen (@ofctimallen) August 20, 2024

His followers were supportive in the comments, offering the ‚ÄúLast Man Standing‚Äù star encouragement and kudos.

‚ÄúEvery time you read it, different verses will pop out at you relative to your current station in life. Truly enlightening,‚Äù one person replied.¬†

‚ÄúCan‚Äôt wait for you to read the gospels!‚Äù Babylon Bee managing editor Joel Berry said.

‚ÄúGood for you, sir,‚Äù David Limbaugh wrote.

‚ÄúYou’re reading a book that changed the history of all mankind and will change your life in big, small, and unexpected ways. If you’re ‚Äòstill that wisecracking kid from the Midwest, looking for answers to life‚Äôs big questions,’ you’re about to find them. So excited for you!‚Äù another follower wrote, referencing Allen‚Äôs X profile.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

The actor has discussed his relationship with Christianity before. In 2022, he spoke with The Wrap about keeping Christ at the center of his ‚ÄúSanta Clauses‚Äù series on Disney+.

‚ÄúIt originally had a lot of otherworldly characters, and ghosts, and goblins. I said no, this is Christ-mas. It’s Christ-mas. It literally is a religious holiday,‚Äù Allen told the outlet. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have to blow trumpets, but I do want you to acknowledge it. That‚Äôs what this is about. If you want to get into Santa Claus, you‚Äôre gonna have to go back to history, and it‚Äôs all about religion.‚Äù

In 2011, Allen opened up about his struggle with faith following his father‚Äôs death after being struck by a drunk driver. The actor was 11 years old at the time of the accident.

‚ÄúFor years, I just did not like this idea of God, church,‚Äù he said at the time, per ABC News. ‚Äú[I was] still a churchgoer, but constantly a cynic.‚Äù

He said he eventually started referring to God as ‚ÄúThe Builder.‚Äù

‚ÄúI always do ask‚Ä¶The Builder, what did you want me to do?‚Äù Allen said. ‚ÄúAnd I do ask it. But you‚Äôve got to be prepared for the answer.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhoever built me, this is too much, too weird that it happened by accident,‚Äù Allen added. ‚ÄúIt didn‚Äôt happen by accident.‚Äù

item.title: RNC Creates Website Laying Out Kamala‚Äôs Policies As She Keeps Voters In The Dark
item.dc:creator: Zach Jewell
item.description: The Republican National Committee paid for the domain kamala2024policies.com and created a website listing some of Vice President Kamala Harris’ “dangerously liberal policies” as her own campaign website still does not have a policy platform. The website features Harris’ leftist record on issues such as criminal justice, immigration, the economy, and the Green New Deal. ...
item.content:encoded:
The Republican National Committee paid for the domain kamala2024policies.com and created a website listing some of Vice President Kamala Harris’ “dangerously liberal policies” as her own campaign website still does not have a policy platform.

The website features Harris’ leftist record on issues such as criminal justice, immigration, the economy, and the Green New Deal. The Democratic candidate has been blasted by Republicans for her campaign website lacking any policy agenda or list of important issues.

“Kamala Harris is weak, failed, and dangerously liberal,” the website states. “Not only does Kamala Harris own the weakness, failure, and chaos of the Harris-Biden administration, she is so radical that she makes ‘the Squad’ look like moderates. She wants to abolish our borders, let criminals control our streets, surrender our communities to cartels and a plague of fentanyl, wage war on American energy, and destroy the American Dream.”

Harris’ first policy proposal on August 6 was a promise to eliminate taxes on tips for service and hospitality workers, the same proposal offered by former President Donald Trump on June 9. The Democratic candidate rolled out economic promises last week, vowing to institute price controls on food items and hand out up to $25,000 to first-time homeowners. Despite making the sweeping promises to voters at a campaign rally in North Carolina, Harris’ campaign website offers no more detail on what these policies entail.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

Trump and Republicans have begun referring to Harris’ economic policies as “communist,” and the former president has called his opponent “Comrade Kamala” multiple times.

“After causing catastrophic inflation, Comrade Kamala announced that she wants to institute socialist price controls,” Trump told a crowd of his supporters in Pennsylvania last weekend.

The RNC highlighted some of Harris’ past comments on health care when she called for the elimination of private health insurance while campaigning during the 2020 Democratic primary. Harris also co-sponsored a bill put forward by Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) to switch to a single-payer “Medicare-for-All” plan, which would have made the federal government completely responsible for covering health care costs.

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

As pointed out on kamala2024policies.com, Harris also boasted about “delivering on the most ambitious climate agenda in history” and has said she supports banning fracking and canceling the Keystone XL pipeline.

As the DNC kicked off earlier this week, the party’s delegates approved the 2024 Democratic platform, which still referred to President Joe Biden as the nominee. According to POLITICO, some congressional Democrats want Harris to keep quiet on her exact platform until after the election, which would be an unprecedented move for a presidential nominee.

item.title: Obama Slammed For Appearing To Make Crude Gesture About Trump During DNC Speech
item.dc:creator: Katie Jerkovich
item.description: Former President Barack Obama was slammed for appearing to make a crude gesture about former President Donald Trump during his speech at the Democratic National Convention. On Tuesday night, Obama took the stage at the DNC in Chicago to loud cheers and applause as the former president took one swipe after another against Trump, appearing, ...
item.content:encoded:
Former President Barack Obama was slammed for appearing to make a crude gesture about former President Donald Trump during his speech at the Democratic National Convention.

On Tuesday night, Obama took the stage at the DNC in Chicago to loud cheers and applause as the former president took one swipe after another against Trump, appearing, at one point, to reference the size of 45‚Äôs lower anatomy, BizPacReview reported.

‚ÄúHere is a 78-year-old billionaire [Trump] who has not stopped whining about his problems since he rode down his golden escalator nine years ago,‚Äù Obama told the audience of Democrat supporters.

‚ÄúA constant stream of gripes, grievances that has been getting worse now that he is afraid to lose to Kamala [Harris],‚Äù he added.

‚ÄúThe childish nicknames, crazy conspiracy theories, this weird obsession with crowd sizes,‚Äù Obama continued, as he motioned with his hands, moving them in from large to small, while appearing to look down at his groin.

Obama appears to make crude hand gesture while describing Trump’s ‘weird obsession’ with crowd sizes https://t.co/eevmLBwJcW pic.twitter.com/0kwgStLvTJ

‚Äî New York Post (@nypost) August 21, 2024

It was clear the gesture was noticed by everyone in the hall and watching at home, including former CNN talk show host Don Lemon, who took to social media and wrote, ‚ÄúWe all knew what that hand gesture meant @BarackObama. @realDonaldTrump is OBSESSED with crowd sizes. #Obama #DNC2024 #tiny.‚Äù

The Wall Street Journal wrote on X, ‚ÄúUsing both hands to ‚Äòdisplay‚Äô different crowd sizes during his address, former President Barack Obama made what appeared to be a sly reference to the male anatomy during his speech at the Democratic National Convention.‚Äù

And those on social media were not pleased.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

‚ÄúBELOW THE BELT? Barack Obama mocks Trump’s ‚Äòweird obsession with crowd sizes,‚Äô then gestures to signify length with his hands and looks down as the #DNC crowd goes wild,‚Äù one person wrote on X.

Another person added, ‚ÄúDid Obama just make a size joke on stage at the #DNC with his hands re Trump? This ain‚Äôt the ‘When they go low, we go high’ party anymore.‚Äù The reference was to when former first lady Michelle Obama said during the 2016 election during an attack against Trump, ‚ÄúWhen they go low, we go high.‚Äù

While a third person wrote, ‚Äúit takes a special kind of politician to complain about childish nicknames and make a small dick joke in the same sentence.‚Äù

The host of “The Megyn Kelly Show” podcast talked about it on her show and said it was obvious that Obama took “a jab at Trump’s manhood.”

During his speech, Obama also threw his support to Vice President Harris ahead of her officially being named the presidential nominee for the Democratic Party.

Related: Obama Praises Biden After Pushing For Him To Leave Race: He Put ‚ÄòHis Own Ambition Aside For The Sake Of The¬†Country‚Äô

item.title: Trump Promises To Ban Transgender Surgeries On Minors Without Parental Consent
item.dc:creator: Mairead Elordi
item.description: Former President Donald Trump’s campaign indicated on Tuesday that he would make performing transgender surgeries on minors without parental consent a felony. The promise appeared in Trump’s prepared remarks for his Tuesday rally at the Livingston County Sheriff‚Äôs Department in Howell, Michigan. Excerpts of his prepared remarks were released by his campaign ahead of the ...
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump’s campaign indicated on Tuesday that he would make performing transgender surgeries on minors without parental consent a felony.

The promise appeared in Trump’s prepared remarks for his Tuesday rally at the Livingston County Sheriff‚Äôs Department in Howell, Michigan. Excerpts of his prepared remarks were released by his campaign ahead of the event.

‚ÄúAnd to protect our children from sexual mutilation, we will make it a felony for any medical professional to perform surgery on a minor without parental consent,‚Äù Trump’s remarks read.

Members of the Trump campaign shared the news about the former president’s vow on social media.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

“BIG NEWS,” posted Karoline Leavitt, the campaign’s national press secretary.

üö®BIG NEWS: https://t.co/xvK2qvKf6A

— Karoline Leavitt (@kleavittnh) August 20, 2024

Trump’s remarks also said he would be “asking for the death penalty for child rapists and child traffickers.”

Transgender medical interventions on minors, which include double mastectomies of girls’ healthy breasts as well as puberty blockers and cross-sex hormones, have become one of the most controversial cultural issues of the last several years.

The Biden administration has pushed to keep such interventions legal for minors, arguing against age restrictions for some transgender procedures in one Alabama court case, documents show.

At least 25 U.S. states have passed restrictions on transgender surgeries and hormone treatments for minors. Republicans in state legislatures have butted heads with Democrats on whether to keep the treatments legal.

Transgender surgeries like double mastectomy and phalloplasty for females and vaginoplasty for males are not reversible. Genital surgeries are less commonly performed on children, but some trans-identifying minors go on to receive them as adults. Some of the effects of hormone treatments, such as voice damage, are also irreversible.

Last year, Trump promised to task several federal agencies with working to ‚Äústop‚Äù transgender medical interventions for minors, calling it ‚Äúchild abuse.‚Äù

Additionally, Trump had said he would prohibit federal agencies from working to ‚Äúpromote the concept of sex and gender transition at any age.‚Äù

The Republican nominee also said last year that he would push schools to ‚Äúpromote positive education about the nuclear family‚Äù and ‚Äúthe roles of mothers and fathers.‚Äù

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

Detransitioners, people who underwent transgender surgeries and hormone treatments at a young age but now express regrets, have spoken out in recent years about how the treatments harmed them. Some have accused their doctors of not addressing their underlying mental issues, such as autism, anxiety, or depression, before shunting them towards transgender medicalization.

Meanwhile, parents have reacted strongly to public schools secretly affirming their children’s new gender identities behind their backs.

More than 19,000 schools across the country have rules saying school staff can or should hide a student‚Äôs gender identity from parents, according to a list compiled by Parents Defending Education.

Only about 44% of Democrats said they are opposed to schools counseling children on their sexual orientation and gender identity without parental knowledge, one poll found last year.

item.title: RFK Jr. Dropping Out Of Race, Will Address Nation While In Same City As Trump: Report
item.dc:creator: Ryan Saavedra
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is reportedly set to drop out of the presidential race this week and will address the nation while speaking in the same city as Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump. ABC News reported that Kennedy will drop out by the end of the week and is leaning toward endorsing Trump, but no ...
item.content:encoded:
Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is reportedly set to drop out of the presidential race this week and will address the nation while speaking in the same city as Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

ABC News reported that Kennedy will drop out by the end of the week and is leaning toward endorsing Trump, but no decision has been finalized.

Kennedy’s campaign said that he will make a live address on Friday in Phoenix, which comes as Trump will be holding a rally in Glendale, Arizona, which is a suburb of Phoenix.

Trump said this week that he was open to Kennedy joining his administration if Kennedy were to drop out and endorse him, which could put Trump over the edge this fall against Democrat presidential nominee Vice President Kamala Harris.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a brilliant guy. He‚Äôs a very smart guy. I‚Äôve known him for a very long time,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know he was thinking about getting out, but if he is thinking about getting out, certainly I‚Äôd be open to it.‚Äù

Trump said that he would ‚Äúlove‚Äù an endorsement from Kennedy because he‚Äôs ‚Äúalways liked‚Äù him.

He indicated that he ‚Äúprobably would‚Äù appoint Kennedy to a role in the administration if Kennedy were to drop out and endorse him.

‚ÄúI like him a lot. I respect him a lot,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúI probably would, if something like that would happen. He‚Äôs a very different kind of a guy ‚Äî a very smart guy. And, yeah, I would be honored by that endorsement, certainly.‚Äù

This is a breaking news story; refresh the page for updates.

item.title: Democrats Have Controlled WH For 12 Of The Last 16 Years, Still Say Everything Is Trump‚Äôs Fault
item.dc:creator: Virginia Kruta
item.description: CNN Republican commentator Scott Jennings keyed in on a bit of irony during the network’s coverage of the Democratic National Convention ‚Äî namely that Democrats want Americans to believe they can fix inflation, the border, and other issues despite the fact that they have controlled the White House for 12 of the last 16 years ...
item.content:encoded:
CNN Republican commentator Scott Jennings keyed in on a bit of irony during the network’s coverage of the Democratic National Convention ‚Äî namely that Democrats want Americans to believe they can fix inflation, the border, and other issues despite the fact that they have controlled the White House for 12 of the last 16 years and have not done so.

Jennings broached the topic during a panel discussion hosted by CNN anchor Anderson Cooper ‚Äî and he asked, among other things, why Vice President Kamala Harris was promising to fix things as president that she did not appear to have any interest in fixing while she was vice president.

WATCH:

Wow‚Ä¶just wow.

Look at the faces on the CNN panel as a huge truth bomb is dropped.

‚ÄúDemocrats have controlled the White House for 12 of the last 16 years, and somehow, it‚Äôs still all Trump‚Äôs fault.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/JFc9zBPAS1

‚Äî SweetPeaBelle (@SweetPeaBell326) August 21, 2024

“She’s in the White House right now,” Jennings said of Harris. “Democrats have controlled the White House for 12 of the last 16 years, and for all of the talk about division and the problems of the country, people are hurting ‚Äî Democrats have mostly controlled the country.”

“Trump had it for four, but the Obamas and Biden had it for the rest of the time,” he continued. “And somehow, it’s still all Trump’s fault, and somehow, [Harris] hasn’t been at the center of it.”

Jennings concluded by asking why Americans should believe that Harris could solve problems as president that she did not appear to even be working on as vice president.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

“So to me, that’s still the glaring hole in this campaign that hasn’t yet been solved at the convention: How do you explain all of the problems that will be solved by the person who is currently in there for the last three-and-a-half years, who is supposed to already be working on solving it?” he asked.

item.title: Adam Sandler Confirms NFL Star Travis Kelce Will Have A Cameo In ‚ÄòHappy Gilmore 2‚Äô
item.dc:creator: Amanda Harding
item.description: Adam Sandler confirmed rumors that Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, who‚Äôs been making headlines all year for his high-profile romance with pop star Taylor Swift, will have a cameo in the upcoming comedy ‚ÄúHappy Gilmore 2.‚Äù ‚ÄúTravis has‚Ä¶ he mentioned it, so we have a nice something for Travis,‚Äù the actor said on ...
item.content:encoded:
Adam Sandler confirmed rumors that Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, who‚Äôs been making headlines all year for his high-profile romance with pop star Taylor Swift, will have a cameo in the upcoming comedy ‚ÄúHappy Gilmore 2.‚Äù

‚ÄúTravis has‚Ä¶ he mentioned it, so we have a nice something for Travis,‚Äù the actor said on a Tuesday night appearance of ‚ÄúThe Tonight Show.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs gonna come by,” Sandler continued. “He‚Äôs a very nice guy. You guys would love him in real life. What a big, handsome guy. Funny and cool as hell. He‚Äôs a stud and he‚Äôs so funny.‚Äù

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

The actor was referring to comments Kelce made about the movie on an episode of his own podcast in May. Kelce said he was a ‚Äúhuge fan of the Sandman [Sandler]‚Äù and would do ‚Äúanything‚Äù to have a chance to appear in the movie.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt even know there was a job opening on ‚ÄòHappy Gilmore 2.‚Äô I‚Äôll be a f***ing extra‚Ä¶ anything to get around Happy Gilmore, an Adam Sandler film or set ‚Äî count me in,‚Äù he said at the time.¬†

Kelce‚Äôs brother and podcast co-host, Jason Kelce, shut down the rumors, saying there was ‚Äúno evidence‚Äù the cameo was happening.

‚Äú[No evidence] other than the movie‚Äôs getting made and I‚Äôm looking for movie deals,‚Äù Travis shot back, Billboard reported. ‚ÄúWho knows? Theories can come true. Theories can be true and people just don‚Äôt know about it. I might even be in the talking and nobody knows about it, but I could also not be in the talking. I‚Äôll do anything in the movie. I‚Äôll be part of it any way I possibly can.‚Äù

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

Netflix announced in May that it was moving forward with a sequel to the 1996 golf comedy ‚ÄúHappy Gilmore,‚Äù starring Sandler as the titular character.

It‚Äôs not unprecedented for Kelce to make an appearance, as the original ‚ÄúHappy Gilmore‚Äù featured cameos from sports stars and celebrities, including golfer Lee Trevino, sportscaster Verne Lundquist, and former “The Price Is Right” host Bob Barker. Other Sandler productions included stars such as former NFL greats Lawrence Taylor, Michael Irvin, and Dan Marino, along with former professional wrestlers Bill Goldberg, Steve Austin, and Kevin Nash.

Kelce, 34, has already dipped his toes into the world of entertainment. He has a role in the upcoming FX horror series ‚ÄúGrotesquerie‚Äù and is hosting the Amazon Prime game show reboot ‚ÄúAre You Smarter Than a Celebrity?‚Äù The nine-time Pro-Bowler is also in talks to star in the action comedy remake ‚ÄúLoose Cannons.‚Äù

There is no planned release date for ‚ÄúHappy Gilmore 2.‚Äù The highly anticipated sequel is slated to start filming in September.¬†

item.title: Study Suggests Tone Of Legacy Media Coverage Amounts To Election Interference
item.dc:creator: Virginia Kruta
item.description: A recent study suggests that the overall tone of legacy media coverage is so biased that it could be considered election interference. The Media Research Center evaluated the major network coverage of the 2024 presidential race ‚Äî specifically Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump ‚Äî in the weeks since President Joe Biden ...
item.content:encoded:
A recent study suggests that the overall tone of legacy media coverage is so biased that it could be considered election interference.

The Media Research Center evaluated the major network coverage of the 2024 presidential race ‚Äî specifically Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump ‚Äî in the weeks since President Joe Biden was effectively forced off the ticket by prominent members of his own party. The results, they said, indicated a dramatic bias in favor of Harris ‚Äî in terms of both the amount of airtime and tone of coverage.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

“It‚Äôs all part of the media‚Äôs massive brainwashing enterprise in support of Kamala,” Fox News host Greg Gutfeld said.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all part of the media‚Äôs massive brainwashing enterprise in support of Kamala. According to a new study by @TheMRC‚Äù 84% of Harris coverage has been positive ‚Äì @greggutfeld on @Gutfeldfox. Watch the video for his risque repartee. Study by @RichNoyes: https://t.co/RF8Yi0Eivm pic.twitter.com/leQSx4dslJ

‚Äî MRC NewsBusters (@newsbusters) August 21, 2024

The bias was apparent first in the amount of airtime given to Harris over Trump between July 21 ‚Äî the day Biden announced he was leaving the presidential race ‚Äî to August 17: Harris received 221 minutes of coverage during evening newscasts on ABC, CBS, and NBC. Trump received 133 minutes of coverage during that same period of time.

It is important to note the context ‚Äî namely, that even though the Democratic Party was in upheaval as it changed candidates and then Harris selected her running mate, the timeframe studied also began just after the Republican National Convention and Trump’s selection of Sen. JD Vance (R-OH) to be his VP, and just over one week after he had been shot at a Pennsylvania rally.

Still, the coverage of the vice presidential candidates bore out a similar pattern. Over the course of 28 days, Vance saw just over 31 minutes of airtime. Minnesota Democratic Governor Tim Walz, Harris’ VP pick, saw just under 32 minutes of airtime, but he got all that coverage in half the time because the clock did not start for him until August 6.

The tone of the coverage showed an even wider gap between the candidates. Evening news coverage included 57 positive comments about Harris and only 11 negative, which translated to a positive spin score of 84%. ¬†Trump, on the other hand, had only 11 positive statements and 86 negative, which gave him a negative spin score of 89%.

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

Again, the same trend continued with the vice presidential candidates: Walz received a 62% positive spin score, and Vance received a 92% negative spin score.

In addition to all of that, major media outlets have continued to downplay issues that could negatively impact either Harris or the Democratic Party ‚Äî while negative stories about Trump or Republicans continue to grow legs.

The real question, MRC concluded, would be whether or not the public would see through the “extraordinarily lopsided coverage.”

item.title: The DNC Held An ‚ÄúIrish Americans For Harris-Walz‚Äù Event. It Was‚Ä¶Awkward.
item.dc:creator: Mairead Elordi
item.description: The slate of prominent Irish-American Democrats who gathered to express their support for Kamala Harris struggled to stay on topic. At times, it felt like last Tuesday’s ‚Äúnational organizing call‚Äù for Irish-Americans supporting Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign could have been something the Democratic National Committee planned before the country‚Äôs Irish-American president took himself off ...
item.content:encoded:
The slate of prominent Irish-American Democrats who gathered to express their support for Kamala Harris struggled to stay on topic.

At times, it felt like last Tuesday’s ‚Äúnational organizing call‚Äù for Irish-Americans supporting Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign could have been something the Democratic National Committee planned before the country‚Äôs Irish-American president took himself off the ticket. But if the event itself felt odd, it was hardly out of place on the Harris-Walz campaign schedule.

The campaign has divvied voters up by their race at several virtual events over the last several weeks. “White Dudes For Harris” made a particular splash, as did “White Women For Kamala,” which featured a TikTok influencer who adopted a condescending tone ‚Äî known as “gentle parenting” on social media ‚Äî to tell the attendees they should never correct people of color.

There are “For Harris” events for every conceivable identity group: black voters, South Asians, Jews, and more. But the event aimed at Irish-Americans seemed particularly awkward in the wake of the Democratic Party’s defenestration of a very-Irish president who is very proud of his heritage.

As New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy said on the call, President Joe Biden was, along with John F. Kennedy, one of the “most Irish-American presidents in the history of our nation.”

At one point, the call became a true Kennedy fest when JFK‚Äôs grandnephew and niece, Joe Kennedy III and Rory Kennedy, chimed in at the same time. Rory Kennedy told a story about a family rosary that was sentimental to her famous Irish-American political family.

Biden sometimes carries a rosary in his pocket and goes to Mass regularly, although he famously flouts the Catholic Church‚Äôs doctrine on abortion, gender ideology, and other issues.

‚ÄúIn Scranton, Irish Catholic Democrat is one word,‚Äù Virginia McGregor, DNC treasurer and national co-chair of Women for Harris said on the call.

Biden himself did not join Tuesday‚Äôs call, although Murphy said the president would likely be ‚Äúquoting an Irish poet or two‚Äù if he were there.

Some of the speakers came armed with jokes.

‚ÄúI think the only thing Donald Trump really understands about Ireland or the Irish culture is the McDonald’s Shamrock Shake every March,‚Äù said Congressman Brendan Boyle (D-PA).

‚ÄúMost important, they‚Äôre not weird,‚Äù Representative Mary Gay Scanlon (D-PA) said about Irish-Americans in her swing state district, referencing the recent online barb from Democrats that the Trump-Vance ticket is ‚Äúweird.‚Äù

Rounding out the call was a bizarre appearance from actress and singer Lynda Carter, known for playing Wonder Woman in the ’70s, who began her remarks by talking about how she didn‚Äôt like her father‚Äôs ‚Äúlast wife‚Äù trying to cut his bushy Irish eyebrows.

Carter also ranted about abortion ‚Äî at one point appearing to forget the word contraception ‚Äî and about men who support former President Donald Trump.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs really not for those men either because he wants to take away their condoms,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey want to take reproductive freedom. They want to take away ‚Äî they want to take away not only our right to choose but, what do you call it? You know. Condoms and all of it. I‚Äôve just lost my way. I get all excited.‚Äù

Former Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe quipped that Democrats ‚Äúneed the Irish because God gave us the gift of gab.”

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre good talkers. There‚Äôs no one better at the doors,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe only problem, when we do door-to-door, we spend too long at each door.‚Äù

Biden is a ‚Äúspectacular president,‚Äù and Kamala will also be a ‚Äúspectacular president,‚Äù McAuliffe said.

Actor Michael Kelly, known for ‚ÄúHouse Of Cards,‚Äù also joined the call and said the country is at an ‚Äúinflection point.‚Äù

‚ÄúLet me tell you, if there is anything that my Irish brothers and sisters know it is how to work,‚Äù the actor said of campaigning for Harris.

Also joining the call were Reps. Tim Kennedy (D-NY) and Dan Kildee (D-MI). All of the speakers told listeners to sign up for the Harris campaign‚Äôs text alerts for Irish-American supporters.

Biden ‚Äúembodied completely‚Äù the Irish qualities of working hard and doing what is right when he dropped out of the 2024 race, McGregor, the DNC treasurer said. She also claimed that, ‚Äúyou cannot travel abroad without hearing how our country‚Äôs global standing has been restored.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre at your summer barbecues make sure you have three quick points about why you‚Äôre voting for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz,‚Äù she added.

Harris and Tim Walz ‚Äúshare the values of the Irish community‚Äù as well, Murphy assured, urging supporters, ‚Äúlet‚Äôs leave no shamrock unturned‚Äù in supporting the new ticket.

‚ÄúKamala Harris, Tim Walz, the Irish, unbeatable!‚Äù the New Jersey governor said.

Editor’s note: Mairead Elordi (n√©e McArdle) is very Irish-American.

item.title: Devastated Family Awaits Sentencing Of Suspected Illegal Immigrant Charged In Fatal Hit-And-Run
item.dc:creator: Zach Jewell
item.description: As the family of a North Carolina man hit and killed in a hit-and-run last year awaits the sentencing of the suspected illegal immigrant who drove the car, the victim’s mother¬†is calling out what she sees as a double standard in the justice system.¬† Twenty-year-old Michael Archuleta, known to loved ones as ‚ÄúLittle Mike,‚Äù was ...
item.content:encoded:
As the family of a North Carolina man hit and killed in a hit-and-run last year awaits the sentencing of the suspected illegal immigrant who drove the car, the victim’s mother¬†is calling out what she sees as a double standard in the justice system.¬†

Twenty-year-old Michael Archuleta, known to loved ones as ‚ÄúLittle Mike,‚Äù was struck and killed by a motorist on November 13 while riding his bike in Brunswick County. Archuleta had almost made it to his family‚Äôs driveway when the suspect, Maria Concepcion Cardona Alejo, allegedly hit him with her 2002 Toyota Sequoia.¬†Alejo allegedly fled the scene of the accident, but was arrested three days later and charged with felony hit-and-run and driving without a license.

Archuleta’s mother, Emily Carpenter, told The Daily Wire it’s “not fair” that her son ‚Äî who had recently scheduled an appointment to get his driver‚Äôs license ‚Äî was killed by an illegal immigrant repeatedly charged with unlicensed driving.

‚ÄúShe was in their courtrooms ten times and they knew that she was just going to keep doing it [breaking the law] because all she has to do is pay her little bit of money and then go down the road,‚Äù Carpenter said.¬†

Between 2009 and 2021, Alejo was given a citation at least seven different times for driving without a license and was slapped with small fines for the infractions. In a 2020 incident, Alejo was pulled over for failing to stop at a flashing red light, along with not having a valid driver‚Äôs license, and was fined $50.¬†

According to the Brunswick County Sheriff‚Äôs booking report, Alejo is a Mexican national. She posted bail a few hours after being detained. Only a few local outlets reported on Archuleta‚Äôs killing and Alejo‚Äôs arrest in November, and the story has gone unreported since then.¬†

An Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) spokesman told The Daily Wire that he could not confirm if Alejo is in the United States illegally because she was bailed out of jail before ICE could issue a detainer request. In order for ICE to issue a detainer, a suspect must be interviewed by an agent in person to determine his or her status.¬†

But Carpenter told The Daily Wire that she was informed by the district attorney‚Äôs office that Alejo is an illegal immigrant. The grieving mother blasted the system of justice that allows an illegal immigrant to ‚Äúhabitually break the law‚Äù with little consequence.

Alejo is expected to plead guilty to the fatal hit-and-run at her sentencing hearing in North Carolina Superior Court on August 26, according to the Bladen, Brunswick, and Columbus County District Attorney‚Äôs Office.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

The morning after the fatal hit-and-run, Archuleta‚Äôs father, Mikie, was taking the family dog outside when a neighbor boy yelled to him, ‚ÄúYour son is dead in the ditch,‚Äù Carpenter recalls.

‚ÄúSo my husband goes running down there ‚Äî with my youngest 10-year-old son following behind him ‚Äî and he jumps into the ditch and my son is hard and cold.‚Äù¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been numb ever since,‚Äù Carpenter added. ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt live there anymore because my son died in that ditch.‚Äù¬†

Carpenter said her son was riding his bike back from a friend‚Äôs house when he was killed, adding that Archuleta‚Äôs bike had reflectors and that he was wearing a brightly colored sweatshirt. Archuleta was developmentally delayed, which put him slightly behind his peers on milestones such as graduating high school and learning how to drive.¬†

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

Carpenter said she has been disappointed with the district attorney‚Äôs handling of the case, saying the assistant district attorney assigned to prosecute her son‚Äôs alleged killer is ‚Äúnot even trying‚Äù to seek a proper sentence. The district attorney’s office told The Daily Wire it could not comment on the ongoing case. When asked if it could confirm that Alijo is in the country illegally, the DA‚Äôs office told The Daily Wire to seek that information from federal authorities.¬†

Archuleta enjoyed working with his hands and planned to become a mechanic. Carpenter said her son was a ‚Äúladies’ man,‚Äù and that she was looking forward to the day she would become a grandmother to his children.

Archuleta‚Äôs family faced more tragedy earlier this year when Mikie Archuleta‚Äôs cousin, Nicholas Simpson, was killed in a hit-and-run by another alleged illegal immigrant in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.¬†

Illegal immigration and the border crisis have become top concerns for voters heading into the 2024 election as border encounters have skyrocketed under the Biden-Harris administration. In the past year, many have expressed outrage after Americans Laken Riley, Ruby Garcia, Jocelyn Nungary, Rachel Morin, and Matt Carney, were allegedly murdered by migrants who had crossed the border illegally.

Carpenter and her family, like the families of those Americans killed, continue to await justice for a loved one.¬†

Asked what Carpenter believes would be a proper sentence for Alijo, she told The Daily Wire, ‚ÄúShe gave me a life sentence. I have to deal with this pain the rest of my life.‚Äù¬†¬†

item.title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Back‚Äô: Republicans Rally In Michigan Outside Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄòLaw And Order‚Äô Speech
item.dc:creator: Leif Le Mahieu
item.description: HOWELL, M.I. ‚Äî Supporters of former President Donald Trump showed up in force on Tuesday afternoon outside of the Livingston County Sheriff‚Äôs Office in Michigan as the former president gave a speech on law and order at a private event. At least one thousand Trump supporters descended upon Howell, about 55 miles northeast of Detroit, ...
item.content:encoded:
HOWELL, M.I. ‚Äî Supporters of former President Donald Trump showed up in force on Tuesday afternoon outside of the Livingston County Sheriff‚Äôs Office in Michigan as the former president gave a speech on law and order at a private event.

At least one thousand Trump supporters descended upon Howell, about 55 miles northeast of Detroit, to line the streets outside the sheriff‚Äôs office where Trump was speaking. Many wore shirts and hats featuring the now-famous picture of Trump being rushed off the rally stage in Pennsylvania after he was nearly killed in an assassination attempt.¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to try to make sure that our folks get as much exposure to the president as possible,‚Äù Livingston GOP Chair Rob Rodriguez-Pelizzari told The Daily Wire outside the sheriff‚Äôs office. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not an everyday occurrence where we get to talk with or even see the President of the United States. We‚Äôre really pumped up about it.‚Äù¬†

Rodriguez-Pelizzari said he would love to host a rally for Trump in the county, which backed Trump by wide margins in 2016 and 2020. He said he handed out all of the 1,000 Trump signs he had ready for the day, adding that Republicans need to maximize voter turnout in red counties like Livingston because there are ‚Äúa lot of voters that aren‚Äôt voting.‚Äù¬†

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

In 2016, Rodriguez-Pelizzari said everyone was ‚Äúsuper excited‚Äù about the election, saying that turnout in Livingston County was the ‚Äúlinchpin‚Äù of Trump‚Äôs victory in Michigan. Trump won the county by 31,000 votes and the election by about 11,000.¬†

“We feel like we‚Äôre pretty important,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe feel like we have to do a really good job here. His presidency is depending on it.‚Äù¬†

Rodriguez-Pelizzari said that energy dipped in 2020 and 2022, but ‚Äúwe‚Äôre back again,‚Äù and ‚Äúeverybody is excited‚Äù for November. He said Republicans in the area were ‚Äúvery mobilized‚Äù and ‚Äúvery responsive.‚Äù¬†

A Trump supporter named Scott, who works in casino management and lives in Brighton, was confident that Trump would perform well in Michigan this year. He said that the ‚Äúsilent majority was not going to be silent anymore,‚Äù adding that he didn‚Äôt trust the polls.

Trump supporters gather in Howell/ Daily Wire.

He said his biggest issues were illegal immigration, high grocery prices, and the economy. He was especially critical of Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äôs price control proposals.¬†

Scott was skeptical of Harris’ promises to fix the economy, the border, and inflation since the Biden-Harris administration has already been in office for nearly four years.

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

As a Midwest voter, he said that he believes the Democrat’s vice presidential candidate, Tim Walz, is ‚Äúmore liberal than Kamala,‚Äù and he’s worried about his ‚Äúincredibly deep ties to China.‚Äù¬†

A group of pro-life Christians was also outside the sheriff’s office, rallying for a woman named Heather Idoni, who has been incarcerated at the Livingston County Jail for her conviction on FACE Act-related charges. Several of those demonstrating held signs saying ‚ÄúFree Heather Idoni.‚Äù

Idoni and six other pro-life Christians were convicted in Detroit earlier in the day on Tuesday on FACE Act and conspiracy against rights charges brought by the Biden-Harris administration. Several of those convicted, including Eva Edl, Cal Zastrow, and Eva Zastrow, were present with the ‚Äúfree Heather‚Äù signs.¬†

During his speech, Trump said that Harris was weak on crime and that there was a spree of lawlessness sweeping Democrat-run cities.”You can’t walk across the street to get a loaf of bread,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou get shot. You get mugged. You get raped. You get whatever it may be.”

Michigan is one of the battleground states that could decide the 2024 election.

item.title: Tim Walz‚Äôs Misleading Claims About Winning Teaching Awards
item.dc:creator: Ashe Schow
item.description: As Minnesota Governor Tim Walz comes under fire for making misleading claims about his military service, IVF treatments, and drunk driving arrest, it seems the vice presidential nominee has also made dubious claims about winning teaching awards. A Daily Wire review found several claims that Walz, a former high school teacher, won either one or ...
item.content:encoded:
As Minnesota Governor Tim Walz comes under fire for making misleading claims about his military service, IVF treatments, and drunk driving arrest, it seems the vice presidential nominee has also made dubious claims about winning teaching awards.

A Daily Wire review found several claims that Walz, a former high school teacher, won either one or two Minnesota Teacher of the Year awards. In reality, he won no such title.

In a 2005 article in the Austin Daily Herald, a reporter who appears to have gotten his information directly from Walz wrote that ‚ÄúTwice, [Walz] was selected a Minnesota teacher of the year for ethics and excellence in education.‚Äù

A local paper’s glowing profile of Tim Walz in 2005:

Walz “served a tour of duty in Operation Iraqi Freedom”

“He was deployed overseas with his National Guard field artillery unit in Operation Iraqi Freedom.”

It appears the reporter interviewed Walz for this piece…ü§î pic.twitter.com/ID3Q2Fm4jE

‚Äî Techno Fog (@Techno_Fog) August 10, 2024

Walz’s biography at VoteSmart lists three teaching awards ‚Äî a 2002 ‚ÄúEthics in Education,” award, a 2003 Minnesota Teacher of Excellence award, and the 2003 Mankato Teacher of the Year award.

In a 2006 congressional campaign ad, a voiceover simply claims that Walz was ‚Äúteacher of the year,‚Äù¬† leaving the impression Walz won a state or national award.

Here is another example of Tim Walz using his Command Sergeant Major rank in a 2006 campaign ad. Walz even implies that he served in Afghanistan.

This is a full year removed from his demotion from a CSM-E9 to a MSG-E8.

This is textbook Stolen Valor.pic.twitter.com/i0I47TBeyI

‚Äî Dustin Grage (@GrageDustin) August 12, 2024

A 2006 article from Walz‚Äôs alma mater, Chadron State College, claimed “In 2002, Walz was one of six Minnesota teachers to receive a $10,000 award recognizing their high performances and contributions to the teaching profession. He also received an Ethics in Education award from the Minnesota Academic Excellence Foundation.‚Äù

Walz’s 2018 campaign website reportedly claimed he won the 2003 Minnesota Teacher of Excellence award, according to On The Issues, which cites the website. The website no longer exists, and instead redirects visitors to Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äô main campaign website.

But Walz was never selected as a Minnesota Teacher of the Year recipient. A¬† website for the award includes a list of past nominees ‚Äì and Walz‚Äôs name does not appear.

Walz did win the Mankato Teachers‚Äô Association‚Äôs Teacher of the Year award ‚Äî a prize given by members of the local teachers‚Äô union ‚Äî in 2002.

In 2003, Walz won an Ethics Award from the Minnesota Academic Excellence Foundation, which comes with a $10,000 prize. But this is not a ‚ÄúTeacher of the Year‚Äù award, nor is it two awards, as the Chadron State College article claimed.

Walz has won two awards related to his teaching, but he did not win any statewide ‚ÄúTeacher of the Year‚Äù awards, as his campaign has led many to believe.

The governor’s claims about his awards are similar to misleading statements he has made about his military service. He served honorably, but he did not see combat in the Middle East or retire as a command sergeant major, as he has claimed or implied multiple times.

Requests to Walz and the Harris-Walz campaign were not returned prior to press time.

item.title: Anti-Israel Protestors Interrupt Colbert‚Äôs Live Interview With Nancy Pelosi Outside DNC
item.dc:creator: Amanda Harding
item.description: Anti-Israel protesters interrupted a live interview between late-night host Stephen Colbert and former Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) on Tuesday night, prompting Colbert to chastise them. The special episode aired live during day two of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where thousands of protestors gathered to demonstrate.¬†¬†¬† Pelosi was discussing her new ...
item.content:encoded:
Anti-Israel protesters interrupted a live interview between late-night host Stephen Colbert and former Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) on Tuesday night, prompting Colbert to chastise them.

The special episode aired live during day two of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where thousands of protestors gathered to demonstrate.¬†¬†¬†

Pelosi was discussing her new book, ‚ÄúThe Art of Power,‚Äù when a woman started chanting in the back of the audience, per Deadline.¬†

Colbert responded by saying, ‚ÄúFor the people at home who can‚Äôt tell, there‚Äôs a protest going on in the audience right now. Hold on young lady, I can hear you. We‚Äôre actually at a commercial break but the subject is on Israel and Palestine, and if you‚Äôll have a seat, we have to go to a commercial break and when we come back I will ask the next question I had on that subject, if you will listen.‚Äù

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

The show went to break, and Colbert returned and asked Pelosi about her opinion on ‚Äúthe proper use of American power‚Äù in foreign countries.¬†

‚ÄúIf the goal is the peaceful and prosperous future for both Israel and Palestinians, what role does the United States play?‚Äù the late-night host asked.

She began by paraphrasing John F. Kennedy. ‚Äú‚ÄòTo the countries of the world, ask not what America can do for you, but what we can do working together for the freedom of mankind‚Äô and that is our mission,‚Äù Pelosi replied.¬†

She continued, ‚ÄúYes, we‚Äôve had a commitment to Israel, that‚Äôs been in our security interest to do so. Israel was attacked by a terrorist organization. We want the hostages freed, but we don‚Äôt want children killed in Gaza, so we have to come up with a solution.‚Äù

‚ÄúWar has no place in a civilized society‚Ä¶ We have to learn more about trust and peace and learning about each other rather than to have a conflict by war,‚Äù Pelosi added.

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

As some audience members kept yelling, Colbert said, ‚ÄúAs you can see from the continuing protest out here, that answer is unsatisfying to some people.‚Äù

‚ÄúIsrael has a right to defend itself ‚Ä¶ But the other part of it that has been so major for all of us for so many years is that there must be a two-state solution. We cannot have peace unless there‚Äôs a two-state solution,‚Äù Pelosi added. ‚ÄúUnless you have a two-state solution, we‚Äôll not have a resolution of this.‚Äù

The yelling continued, which prompted Colbert to address the audience, saying, ‚ÄúPlease don‚Äôt interrupt my guests.‚Äù

RELATED: Protesters Breach DNC’s ‘Wall’ Before First Speaker Takes The Stage

item.title: The Democrat Foreign Policy Platform: Don‚Äôt Believe Your Own Eyes
item.dc:creator: Morgan Ortagus
item.description: True to form, the Democratic Party‚Äôs 2024 foreign policy platform is as full of historical revisionism as one would predict. Its contents range from artful dodging to outright untruths. Most importantly, the platform is divorced from the actual Biden-Harris foreign policy record of the last four years. The most blatant omissions are on Afghanistan, found ...
item.content:encoded:
True to form, the Democratic Party‚Äôs 2024 foreign policy platform is as full of historical revisionism as one would predict.

Its contents range from artful dodging to outright untruths. Most importantly, the platform is divorced from the actual Biden-Harris foreign policy record of the last four years.

The most blatant omissions are on Afghanistan, found in a section absurdly titled ‚ÄúLeading with Diplomacy and American Values.‚Äù The platform gives a single cursory mention to the withdrawal, stating that the White House ‚Äúended America‚Äôs longest war‚Äù and led the ‚Äúlargest resettlement effort since the Vietnam War.‚Äù That‚Äôs certainly one way to describe a humiliating retreat that left Americans trapped behind enemy lines, killed 13 military heroes, ignored clear intelligence warnings, and unleashed a historic humanitarian disaster. A subsequent section touts the Biden-Harris administration as a ‚Äústrong advocate for the rights and opportunities of women and girls.‚Äù Did they already forget about the millions of women and girls they relegated to Taliban rule?

The platform‚Äôs discussion of Iran is Orwellian, touting the administration‚Äôs “aggressive diplomacy” to “defend against Iran.” In other words: relentless appeasement, unchecked attacks on troops and diplomats, ransom payments, and billions in sanctions relief for the leading state sponsor of terrorism. No U.S. presidency has done more to enrich and embolden the regime, and it‚Äôs not even close.

Then comes Russia. The platform argues Democrats have successfully helped Kyiv ‚Äúdefend its territory.‚Äù Don’t they know Russia murdered its way through Ukraine under its watch? We all remember how Biden and Harris set the stage for Putin‚Äôs invasion with the ‚Äúminor incursion‚Äù gaffe, repeated weapons delays, desperate diplomacy, and their refusal to sanction the Nord Stream 2 pipeline.

The Middle East section does its best to be all things to all people, paying rhetorical lip service to Israel while nodding to Palestinian grievances. Most incredibly, the platform touts Democrats‚Äô supposed defense of Israel at the United Nations. Is that what they meant by restoring funding for UNRWA‚Äôs terrorism, legitimizing the anti-Semitic Human Rights Council, and letting anti-Israel resolutions pass in the Security Council?

To no surprise, the platform also avoids a clear stance on deterring the Chinese Communist Party. Instead, it discusses the need to ‚Äúmanage‚Äù our ‚Äúmost consequential strategic competitor,‚Äù avert ‚Äúa costly spiral to conflict,‚Äù and ‚Äúidentify new areas where the United States and China may be able to work together.‚Äù Forget a theory of victory ‚Äî we all know this is a euphemism for accommodation and appeasing the CCP. And to remove any wonder as to whether Democrats view the PRC as America‚Äôs top security threat, the platform also clarifies that ‚Äúthere is nothing more important than addressing the climate crisis.‚Äù

Is it even worth discussing its absurd border claims? The platform outrageously claims the White House took ‚Äúdecisive action to secure our border‚Äù and ‚Äúdecreased illegal border crossings.‚Äù Even progressives know this is a farce. Biden and Kamala willfully abetted illegal immigration and fueled border chaos.

Regarding Latin America, the platform argues the Biden-Harris Administration ‚Äústrengthened ties with key allies across the Hemisphere.‚Äù But their only new friends seem to be Left-wing authoritarians like the FARC (delisted as a Foreign Terrorist Organization by the Blinken State Department) and Maduro, who has enjoyed sweeping sanctions relief, freed relatives, and political cover for his sham election.

The platform also boasts of ‚Äúhistoric investments‚Äù in military capacity ‚Äì quite a claim from a White House that sought to cut the Pentagon‚Äôs buying power. The Biden-Harris Administration has made our military budget its smallest since World War II. And lest we forget, Kamala has even acknowledged that she ‚Äúunequivocally agree[s]‚Äù with the goal of reducing the defense budget.

Americans should be outraged at these distortions, which neglect the war and chaos that have spread across nearly every theater under Biden and Harris. Our national security is clearly weaker under their leadership. Americans know we are less safe and that Kamala would only accelerate the foreign policy failures of the Biden presidency.

* * *

Morgan Ortagus is the Founder of POLARIS National Security and host of “The Morgan Ortagus Show” on SiriusXM. During the Trump Administration, she served at the Department of State as the Spokeswoman for the United States of America.

The views expressed in this piece are those of the author and do not necessarily represent those of The Daily Wire.

item.title: Axios Attempts To Defend Kamala‚Äôs Price Control Plan, Receives Brutal Community Note On X
item.dc:creator: Zach Jewell
item.description: An Axios reporter rushed to the defense of Vice President Kamala Harris’ heavily criticized proposal to control grocery prices on Tuesday, but her article was hit by a community note on X that provided some important context. Axios Markets Correspondent Emily Peck wrote, “One of Kamala Harris’ most controversial policy proposals is a ban on ...
item.content:encoded:
An Axios reporter rushed to the defense of Vice President Kamala Harris’ heavily criticized proposal to control grocery prices on Tuesday, but her article was hit by a community note on X that provided some important context.

Axios Markets Correspondent Emily Peck wrote, “One of Kamala Harris’ most controversial policy proposals is a ban on grocery price gouging ‚Äî critics are conflating the idea with Soviet-style price controls, and calling the plan ‘Kamunism.'” Peck added, “If banning price gouging is communist, then the U.S. went Marxist long ago. Most of us live in states that already have bans in place.”

Axios also posted a link to the article on X with the caption, “Don‚Äôt call it price controls: How price gouging bans really work.”

X slapped a community note on Axios’ post, pointing out that the same author called it “price controls” when the U.K. considered a short-term policy in 2023 to push retailers to agree to standardized prices on certain groceries like milk and bread. In 2022, another Axios writer, Matt Phillips, referred to the G-7’s pledge to limit how much Russia could profit from oil sales as “price controls.”

Don‚Äôt call it price controls: How price gouging bans really work https://t.co/tyPKx1nayt

‚Äî Axios (@axios) August 20, 2024

Harris promised last week that her administration would punish companies for “price-gouging” as food prices have increased due to high inflation rates over the past three years. Bread and ground beef have risen in cost by around 50% since before the pandemic when Donald Trump was in the White House. Dairy products such as milk, cheese, and butter have also jumped more than 30% in price since 2020, according to Yahoo Finance. Eggs are up 54%, and cereal has gone up 28% on average across the country.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

Peck argued that a Harris administration would likely attempt to expand on existing state laws that seek to prevent large companies from hiking prices on essential items during emergencies, such as a hurricane. She wrote that Harris has not provided much detail on her plan, which, Peck claimed, has “led to wild speculation about what the plan could mean.” The Axios reporter also argued in favor of Harris’ proposal, writing, “One advantage of a national ban is that the federal government would have more power to go after big global corporations that are hard to pursue at the state level.”

Trump referred to the Democratic nominee’s plan as “communist,” saying last week that such a proposal would “have the exact opposite impact and effect and it leads to food shortages, rationing, hunger, dramatically more inflation.”

Even the Left-leaning Washington Post ran an op-ed blasting Harris for the price control plan.

WATCH THE TRAILER FOR ‚ÄòAM I RACIST?‚Äô ‚Äî A MATT WALSH COMEDY ON DEI

‚ÄúAt best, this would lead to shortages, black markets and hoarding, among other distortions seen previous times countries tried to limit price growth by fiat,‚Äù Catherine Rampell wrote. ‚Äú(There‚Äôs a reason narrower ‚Äòprice gouging‚Äô laws that exist in some U.S. states are rarely invoked.) At worst, it might accidentally raise prices.‚Äù

item.title: Labor Dept Overestimated Job Growth By More Than 800K, Revises Data
item.dc:creator: Tim Pearce
item.description: Government figures for job growth over the past year have been significantly revised after being overestimated by more than 800,000 jobs. The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported Wednesday that job growth throughout the 12 months ending in March would be revised downward by 818,000 jobs, a hefty drop that is roughly equivalent to 0.5% of ...
item.content:encoded:
Government figures for job growth over the past year have been significantly revised after being overestimated by more than 800,000 jobs.

The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported Wednesday that job growth throughout the 12 months ending in March would be revised downward by 818,000 jobs, a hefty drop that is roughly equivalent to 0.5% of total jobs, according to The Washington Examiner. A downward revision of more than 501,000 would be the largest in 15 years.

The drop knocks the average monthly job growth over those 12 months down from about 242,000 jobs to about 174,000. The revisions are preliminary and part of an annual review process that reconciles and revises monthly data with more reliable but slower-coming records from state governments, according to The New York Times.

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

Daily Wire host Ben Shapiro said in a post on X that the revision is ‚Äúamazing for two reasons.‚Äù

First, ‚Äú[t]hey’ve been lying for a year about Biden job creation,‚Äù Shapiro said. Secondly, ‚Äú[t]hey’re dumping this data just in time to justify a Federal Reserve interest rate decrease for the election.‚Äù

This is amazing for two reasons.
1. They’ve been lying for a year about Biden job creation.
2. They’re dumping this data just in time to justify a Federal Reserve interest rate decrease for the election. https://t.co/p5D8aqT7EW

‚Äî Ben Shapiro (@benshapiro) August 21, 2024

 

The revised figures will be incorporated into official government data next year after the revisions are finalized.

The revision would bring jobs numbers into line with other economic indicators that have suggested that the strong jobs reports over the past year were at the very least an outlier, if not giving a false impression of the health of the economy, according to the Times.

Michelle Bowman, a member of the Federal Reserve‚Äôs Board of Governors, said in a speech on Tuesday that there are ‚Äúrisks that the labor market has not been as strong as the payroll data have been indicating.‚Äù

The reduction in the jobs numbers may be cited by Federal Reserve officials next month if they decide to lower interest rates. A lowered interest rate could become a campaign talking point for Vice President Kamala Harris as she tries to find an economic message that can connect with Americans who are concerned about the health of the economy by a wide majority.

‚ÄúA large negative revision would indicate that the strength of hiring was already fading before this past April,‚Äù Wells Fargo economists Sarah House and Aubrey Woessner wrote last week, according to the New York Post. A large revision would make ‚Äúrisks to the full employment side of the Fed‚Äôs dual mandate more salient amid widespread softening in other labor market data.‚Äù

item.title: 50 Republican Vets In Congress Sign Letter Condemning Walz For ‚ÄòLying‚Äô About His Military Service
item.dc:creator: Hank Berrien
item.description: On Wednesday, Congressman Brian Mast (R-FL), who lost both legs when he served in Afghanistan as a U.S. Army explosive ordnance disposal technician in 2010, led a group of 50 Republican veterans in Congress to endorse a letter condemning Minnesota Democratic Governor Tim Walz‚Äôs lies about his military service. ‚ÄúThe Office of the Vice President ...
item.content:encoded:
On Wednesday, Congressman Brian Mast (R-FL), who lost both legs when he served in Afghanistan as a U.S. Army explosive ordnance disposal technician in 2010, led a group of 50 Republican veterans in Congress to endorse a letter condemning Minnesota Democratic Governor Tim Walz‚Äôs lies about his military service.

‚ÄúThe Office of the Vice President is a position that requires the trust of the American people and a solemn commitment to duty on behalf of the United States of America,‚Äù the letter began. ‚ÄúAs veterans who have served our nation, we feel compelled to address your egregious misrepresentations and urge you to come clean to the American people.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou have stated that you are ‚Äòdamn proud‚Äô of your service, and like any American veteran, you should be,‚Äù they stated. ‚ÄúBut there is no honor in lying about the nature of your service. Repeatedly claiming to be a ‚ÄòRetired Command Sergeant Major‚Äô when you did not complete the requirements was not honorable. Nor was it honorable to claim to carry weapons ‚Äòin war‚Äô when you had not served in war, and abandoning the men and women under your leadership just as they were getting ready to deploy was certainly not honorable either.‚Äù

Tickets for ‚ÄúAm I Racist?‚Äù are on sale NOW! Buy here for a theater near you.

‚ÄúTo be blunt, when you falsely claim military service that did not happen and abandon your post, you diminish the real sacrifices made by veterans who did serve in combat,‚Äù they charged. ‚ÄúMilitary service is not merely a job or a uniform. Those who serve in the Armed Forces endure rigorous training, face perilous situations, and make sacrifices that most civilians can‚Äôt comprehend. The honor of wearing the uniform is earned through dedication, bravery, and an unwavering sense of duty. You have displayed none of these characteristics as you have lied your way through a political career launched on the foundation of a title you did not earn and combat deployments you did not take part in.‚Äù

‚ÄúIn short, our grave concern stems from the fact that the office of the Vice President is one heartbeat away from becoming the Commander-In-Chief. You‚Äôve already demonstrated your unwillingness to lead in time of war and a lack of honor through your blatant misrepresentations exploiting and co-opting the experiences of America‚Äôs combat veterans for personal gain,‚Äù they declared.
